result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason G Schienbein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Jefferson County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs, DNA surcharge and Buy Money (payable to Waukesha Metro Drug Unit) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Buy Money is to be paid joint/several with co-actor.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the co-actor (Ryan Anderson) listed in the Criminal Complaint.
If DNA sample has already been provided, Court will waive sample and surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 07:00 p.m. on 04-14-2016.
Court will allow for transfer to Jefferson County.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jason G Schienbein in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.




Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  1.5 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation: 1.5 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Court will allow for transfer to Jefferson County.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  co-actor (Ryan Anderson) listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Buy Money:  $700 to be joint/several with co-actor(to be paid to Waukesha Metro Drug Unit) - to be paid within the first year of probation.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department - IF ALREADY PROVIDED COURT WILL WAIVE THE SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
60 Days in the Wauesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Court will allow for to be served through Jefferson County.
Defendant to report to the huber facility by 7 pm. on 04/14/16.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 04-11-2016 02:00 pm
